bib.title: The same network-different communities? The multidimensional study of groups in the cyberspace
bib.author: Michalski, Rados{\l}aw and Jankowski, Jaros{\l}aw and Br{\'o}dka, Piotr and Kazienko, Przemys{\l}aw
bib.abstract: Methods of social network analysis are evolving into the practice of analyzing multi-layer networks, which represent different dimensions of activity and relationships. This also applies to methods oriented to detect communities in order to analyze the relationship between groups on different layers. In this context, the purpose of this article is to answer the question of how much the communities in cyberspace overlap when studying a variety of forms of interactions. The authors analyzed the structure of user groups formed on different
bib.booktitle: 2014 IEEE/ACM International Conference on Advances in Social Networks Analysis and Mining (ASONAM 2014)
